hivis.data.view

Class CalcValue<I,O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • hivis.data.DataDefault
      • hivis.data.AbstractDataValue<V>
        • hivis.data.AbstractUnmodifiableDataValue<O>
          • hivis.data.view.AbstractValueView<I,O>
            • hivis.data.view.CalcValue<I,O>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Data, DataListener, DataValue<O>, Comparable<O>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CalcValue.DoubleValue, CalcValue.FloatValue, CalcValue.IntValue, CalcValue.LongValue

    public abstract class CalcValue<I,O>
extends AbstractValueView<I,O>
    Base class for creating DataValues that are calculated from zero, one or more other DataValues. If input values are provided then change events on those values are forwarded to this DataValue. The calculated value is cached. Cached values are lazily (re)calculated on the first call to get(), getBoolean() etc.
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

    • Method Detail

      • updateView

        public void updateView(DataEvent cause)
        Update the cache value. The default implementation calls calc(). Sub-classes may override this to provide a more efficient implementation, for example avoiding autoboxing if a primitive type is stored.

      • calc

        public abstract O calc()
        This is the method where you implement the function. Implementations must calculate and return the value that a call to DataValue.get() should return (based on the AbstractValueView.inputValues if applicable). The value returned will be cached and returned by calls to get().

      • calcBoolean

        public boolean calcBoolean()
        Primitive equivalent to calc(). This allows for more efficient implementations of #updateView(Object) if a primitive type is stored. This implementation throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

      • calcInteger

        public int calcInteger()
        Primitive equivalent to calc(). This allows for more efficient implementations of #updateView(Object) if a primitive type is stored. This implementation throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

      • calcLong

        public long calcLong()
        Primitive equivalent to calc(). This allows for more efficient implementations of #updateView(Object) if a primitive type is stored. This implementation throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

      • calcFloat

        public float calcFloat()
        Primitive equivalent to calc(). This allows for more efficient implementations of #updateView(Object) if a primitive type is stored. This implementation throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

      • calcDouble

        public double calcDouble()
        Primitive equivalent to calc(). This allows for more efficient implementations of #updateView(Object) if a primitive type is stored. This implementation throws an UnsupportedOperationException.
